column1: SPURN HEAD ROYAL NAVY SIGNAL STATION
# The February 1947 figure is shown on the sheet in brackets and has been retained.
# The grid reference on the 1950s sheet is near the Lifeboat Inn rather than the signal station itself.
# The 1950s sheet reports problems with the gauge often being buried by sand.
# The station continued until 1964 according to MIDAS.
